column1: Meniscal allograft transplantation is surgery in which a meniscus -- a cartilage ring in the knee -- is placed into your knee.
If your doctor finds that you are a good candidate for a meniscus transplant, x-rays of your knee are usually taken to find a meniscus that will fit your knee.
- The surgeon inspects the cartilage and ligaments of your knee, confirming that a meniscus transplant is appropriate, and that you don't have severe arthritis of the knee.
Some people can still have pain after the meniscus is removed.
